title: Fullstack developer
description:
About Us
  
Din Psykolog is a web-based application that allows users to consult with psychologists online via chat. Our mission is to make professional psychological care more accessible while breaking down stigmas surrounding mental health. Through Din Psykolog, users can access expert help within 24 hours, no matter where they are. Your work will help thousands of people access life-changing psychological care more conveniently, breaking barriers in mental health.
  
  

Are You the Full-Stack Developer We're Looking For?
  
We're seeking a talented full-stack developer to join our team. In this role, you will be instrumental in developing and implementing new features for our web applications, supporting our rapid growth in users and technological capabilities. You will have the opportunity to contribute throughout the entire development process, turning ideas into reality.
  
  

Required Skills
  
Proficient in JavaScript programming with at least 6 years of experience in building UIs with HTML and CSS
  
Experience with React.js (3+ years)
  
Experience with Node.js (3+ years)
  
Experience with PostgreSQL (2+ years)
  
Proficient in using Git (2+ years of practical experience)
  
  

Who You Are
  
8+ years of software development work experience
  
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field, or equivalent experience
  
Exceptional attention to detail
  
Self-driven and passionate about learning new technologies
  
Strong focus on delivering value to users
  
A collaborative team player who thrives in a supportive environment
  
Interested in mentoring and guiding junior colleagues
  
Excellent communicator
  
Comfortable taking initiative
  
  

Bonus Skills
  
Experience with Google Cloud Platform
  
Interest in the field of psychology
  
Previous experience working at a startup
  
  

What We Offer
  
Flexible working hours
  
Opportunities for skill development
  
Competitive salary in line with industry standards and Swedish collective agreements
  
Health insurance, life insurance, and pension contributions
  
  

Our culture
  
Din Psykolog AB is an equal opportunity employer. We foster a supportive, collaborative, and inclusive work environment where we celebrate each other's achievements, learn from challenges, and genuinely enjoy working together. We value diversity and welcome team members from all backgrounds and experiences, including applicants from anywhere in the world who meet Swedish work permit requirements and can relocate to Stockholm.
  
  

Additional Information
  
**Start date:** Immediate, with consideration of notice periods
  
**Location:** Stockholm, with flexible remote work options. Occasional in-office meetings will foster collaboration and team bonding. The primary work location is Stockholm.
  
**Contract type:** Full-time, permanent position
  
**Working hours:** 40 hours per week
  
  

How to Apply
  
Ready to make an impact? Apply now and join us in reshaping the future of mental health care! For questions about the recruitment process, please contact CTO Magnus Bondesson, magnus@dinpsykolog.se.

title: Developer Internship (Python &/or TypeScript/JavaScript) - Gain Hands-On Experience at an Award-Winning Google Cloud Partner
description:
- As a pioneering Google Cloud partner, we pride ourselves on our collaborative, innovative culture that fosters learning and growth. With a team of over 600 Google Cloud experts and 1000+ certifications, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to over 2600 customers across 18 countries.

  
Dive into the world of cloud computing with Devoteam G Cloud, the leading experts in Google Cloud solutions across the Nordics! We're offering exciting unpaid internship opportunities **from January to May 2025** for driven individuals with a passion for development. Gain hands-on experience working with Python and/or TypeScript/JavaScript and **become a part of our Digital Lab!**

This internship offers you the chance to actively contribute to real-world projects within our Digital Lab, a fast-paced, agile environment. You'll collaborate with experienced developers, learn best practices, and contribute to the development of innovative solutions using cutting-edge technologies within the Google Cloud ecosystem.


  
**Your Profile**

* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.
* Solid understanding of Python and/or TypeScript/JavaScript.
* Familiarity with Git and version control.
* Eagerness to learn and contribute to a team.
* Interest in cloud computing and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a plus.

**What You Gain**

* Practical experience in software development using Python and/or TypeScript/JavaScript.
* Exposure to Google Cloud Platform and its various services.
* Mentorship from experienced developers and industry experts.
* Opportunity to build your professional network in the cloud computing field.
* Dynamic environment that encourages creativity and personal development.

  
- ***"The Devoteam G Cloud internship provided me with invaluable hands-on experience in a real-world development environment. The supportive team and collaborative culture allowed me to grow both personally and professionally."*** - Julien Gumy, former Devoteam Intern
  

  

**Apply Now!**  

Ready to launch your development career at the forefront of cloud computing? Submit your CV and a motivational letter highlighting your relevant skills and why you're the ideal candidate for this internship. We celebrate diversity and are an equal opportunities employer.
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Embedded Software Developer
description:
Are you ready to contribute to the next generation of telematics products and services? At
 *Presis Konsult* 
 , we are seeking a passionate and experienced
 **Embedded Software Developer** 
 to join our agile team and play a key role in developing cutting-edge technology for on-board systems.
 



 Our main product is an advanced information system embedded within vehicles, seamlessly communicating with other vehicle systems and a back-office system. Key features include Fleet Management, Uptime services, and a range of connected services.
 



  





**Your Mission:** 




  





 As an Embedded Software Developer, you'll be instrumental in creating and enhancing telematics solutions, applying your expertise in C++, embedded Linux, and advanced software development techniques. You'll work alongside a collaborative, agile team to deliver continuous improvements in software architecture, system verification, and development of fleet management services.
 



  





**We’re Looking For:** 




  




* At least
 **12 years of experience** 
 in embedded software development
* Strong proficiency in
 **C++ (C++17 & C++20)** 
 , and familiarity with
 **Python**
* Hands-on experience with
 **Embedded Linux** 
 ,
 **Yocto** 
 , and
 **CommonApi**
* **Automatic test development** 
 expertise
* Automotive Experience
* Perform software validation using Simulink Test and Test Viewer
* Ensure functional safety compliance according to ISO 26262 standards
* Use Autosar for automotive software configuration and development.
* Manage software requirements and documentation to ensure ASPICE compliance
* Experience with Pytest for automated testing of infotainment software
* Working experience in a CI/CD environment, crucial for modern automotive software development.
* **Software Development:** 
 Design, develop, and maintain software for steering systems, including EPAS, steer-by-wire, and ADAS-related functionalities.
* **System Architecture:** 
 Ability to understand and contribute to system architecture for optimal embedded software design
* **Control Algorithms:** 
 Develop precise control algorithms to ensure accurate and responsive vehicle steering.
* **Testing and Validation:** 
 Develop and execute validation test plans, including unit, integration, and system-level testing using simulation tools and real-world environments
* **Test Automation (Pytest):** 
 Experience in using Pytest for testing automation
* **OTA (Over-the-Air Updates):** 
 Prior experience with OTA updates within the infotainment domain
* Manage OTA updates for infotainment, contributing to enhanced vehicle functionality
* A
 **Master’s degree** 
 in Electronics, Computer Engineering, or related field
* Excellent
 **English communication skills** 
 (both written and spoken)
* Experience in the
 **Scrum Master role** 
 is a plus
* A proactive, creative team player who is eager to share knowledge and take responsibility



  





**What We Offer:** 




  




* Work in an
 **agile environment** 
 , focusing on continuous improvements
* A
 **dynamic, collaborative team** 
 with a shared vision
* Opportunities to develop deep expertise in
 **C++** 
 and telematics products



  





**Join us at
 *Presis Konsult* 
 , where innovation meets passion.**

title: Senior Java Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 Senior Java Software Engineer
   

  

**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The O** 
**pportunity**
 We are looking for a versatile Senior Software Engineer in Java for our Security team. In this position, you will be an active member of a highly-skilled Dev-Ops team, responsible for building, running, and maintaining security services across multiple software platforms within Worldline - Serving internal users, partners, and our valued customers.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
 We are a DevOps team who proudly build, run and support our own products.
   

  

* Develop microservices based on Java technologies
* Contribute in technical design, code-reviews and build solutions to improve the customer centricity.
* Work with cross functional teams of Architects, Product managers and Engineers.
* Being active in our agile events like daily standups, planning, retros, demos, etc.
* Facilitating across teams and helping foster collaboration and open communication.
* Securing an outstanding qualitative service availability 24/7/365 where 3rd line on-call duty is expected according to a rotating schedule.


**Who Are We Looking For**
 People who are passionate about developing and operating products and services that bring value to our customers, your team, and your business. You act as a role model to team members and others by staying committed, showing accountability, and delivering results. We always set our team delivery first! You also have:
   

  

* Proven experience in software development with high proficiency in Java.
* Experience in developing robust micro-services with high transaction intensity and availability.
* Experience in Identity and Access Management, Application and network security.
* Experience in working with Version control systems (Git), and CI/CD pipelines.
* Deep understanding of both on-premise and Cloud Infrastructure platforms - preferably GCP.
* Strong desire to learn new technologies and concepts.
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, security, engineering, or other relevant fields.
* Deep understanding of software quality assurance principles.
* Full working proficiency in English.
* Are comfortable in a fast-paced environment, handling many different partners, prioritizing, and making quick decisions daily.
* Curious attitude, continuously learning and sharing your knowledge with your peers and others.


 To fully enjoy our autonomous and agile ways it would be great if you also have:
   

  

* Hands-on-experience in cloud computing, dockerization and kubernetes.
* Prior DevOps experience, including fostering the DevOps culture, automation, lean flow, measurement, and recovery.
* Knowledge in front-end development preferably in React.
* Experience in developing secure PCI-DSS certified solutions is considered an advantage .


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Supplemental Health Insurance and Private Health Care
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Events and happenings at the office
* Convini Vending Machine, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

**Learn more about life at Worldline at** 
**jobs.worldline.com**
**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Business developer, Product introductions, Chassi & Cab
description:
Do you want to be an important part of our future?
   

  

 We are looking for a driven Business Developer to lead and manage process development projects within Scania and TRATON related to the product development process, ONE PDP. You will be part of an exciting journey, introducing a common module system for the entire group through a joint TRATON R&D-led flow landscape. Your role will involve developing, improving, and training our methods within ONE PDP for Production and Logistics.
   

  

**About Us**
 Our department is a central part of Scania P&L, Production & Logistics, responsible for leading, coordinating, and training in process and method development within the Product Development Process (ONE PDP). We work closely with several departments within Scania and TRATON to ensure a high level of knowledge and experience within the Product Development Process.
   

  

**Tasks**
* Lead the development and maintenance of common methods related to the PD process within both Scania P&L and TRATON.
* Educate employees to maintain a high level of PDP knowledge and experience within Scania P&L to create conditions for efficient production regarding safety, ergonomics, quality, delivery, and cost.
* Represent product introductions, chassis, and cab in the development and training of ONE PDP.
* Represent P&L in the forums we are active in.


**Your Profile**
 We are looking for someone who is passionate about their job and wants to lead our business in an unpretentious way, helping others to grow. You need to be comfortable working with feedback and challenging yourself, your team, colleagues, and decision-makers. As a person you are curious, driven, well-structured, can manage parallel assignments, and have good communication skills. Your interest in leadership and people is essential.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Good knowledge of PDP and related processes.
* Experience in leading and coordinating projects within product development.
* Relevant education from university and working experience within leadership (or similar).
* You communicate fluently in English both orally and in writing, and if you don't already speak Swedish you have a great ambition to learn.
* Experience working in a global organisation is a merit.


**We Offer**
* Development opportunities and training to strengthen your competence and career.
* Opportunity to work with committed and competent colleagues in various parts of the organisation.
* A dynamic and challenging work environment with the opportunity to influence and contribute to Scania's future development.
* An opportunity to broaden your network within TRATON.


**More Information**
 If you want more information about this position, don't hesitate to get in touch with Jonas Littorin, Manager Process Development, Product Introductions, email: jonas.littorin@scania.com
   

  

 During the Christmas holiday season, you can expect some delays in the replies. We hope for your understanding.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and copies of grades. Scania uses tests in the recruitment process. A background check may be conducted for this position. Selection and interviews will start in the second and third week of January. Apply via Career | Scania Group as soon as possible, but no later than January 12, 2025.
   

  

**Please note:** 
 If you are a Scania employee, you must log in and apply via MySuccess/Careers.
   

  

 Scania is a world-leading provider of transport solutions. Together with our partners and customers we are driving the shift towards a sustainable transport system. In 2022, we delivered 80,238 trucks, 4,994 buses as well as 13,400 industrial and marine power systems to our customers. Net sales totalled to over SEK 170 billion, of which 21 percent were services related. Founded in 1891, Scania now operates in more than 100 countries and employs some 57,000 people. Research and development are mainly concentrated in Sweden. Production takes place in Europe and Latin America with regional product centres in Africa, Asia and Eurasia. Scania is part of TRATON GROUP. For more information visit: www.scania.com

title: iOS Developer
description:
RaySearch has several cancer care products, and we are now looking to hire our first iOS Developer for our Oncology Information System, RayCare.
   

  

**About RayCare**
 RayCare is a client-server application that runs on premises at many clinics all over the world. RayCare takes care of and helps clinical staff to coordinate their work at the clinic. For example, workflow management, patient chart details and treatment management. RayCare is an innovative Oncology Information System (OIS) designed to support the complex challenges of modern oncology clinics. It is developed to streamline workflows in cancer clinics to facilitate efficient care faster to more patients. RayCare is used by all staff at the clinic, e.g., physicians, physicists, treatment planners etc. and is used in all steps of patient care, from registration to radiation treatment at the treatment machine and for treatment follow-up.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As our first iOS Developer, you will pioneer the development of our iOS application for RayCare, enabling you to make a significant impact from the very beginning. In this role, you will be essential in shaping and delivering the application!
   

  

 You will be tasked with integrating the native iOS application with the .NET backend. Additionally, you will contribute to technical decisions across platforms, requiring familiarity with front-end technologies and frameworks, like WPF and Angular. Collaboration with other developers, architects, and product managers will be key to ensuring that our application meets the rigorous standards necessary for improving cancer care.
   

  

**Your profile**
 As a self-motivated individual, you possess a strong ability to take ownership of your work, demonstrating significant drive and initiative. With meticulous attention to detail, a commitment to quality, and a dedication to excellence in all tasks, effective communication skills enable you to present and advocate for your ideas confidently. You possess strong analytical skills and have a solid understanding of technical risks, with proven experience managing projects from start to finish. You take pride in consistently delivering high-quality results.
   

  

**Requirements**
* M.Sc. in Engineering Physics, Computer Science or equivalent academic degree
* Minimum seven years of iOS development experience
* Strong proficiency in Swift
* Previous experience with iOS clients communicating with a .NET backend
* Experience with the Apple developer provisioning and approval process
* Front-end development with frameworks such as WPF and/or Web technologies such as TypeScript, Angular, etc.


**Meriting**
* Being able to read and understand C# .NET
* Experience from the MedTech-industry or other regulated industries
* Experience from functioning as Tech lead in iOS development
* Knowledge and experience in developing Web and/or desktop applications


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

**Application**
 Please apply to the position through the application form below. We do not accept applications by e-mail. Selection and interviews will be ongoing.

title: UX Designer Expert (~50% remote)
description:
**Job Description:** UX Designer Expert

**Position Overview:**  
Consumer Services at our Connected Solutions division is responsible for end-user services, from ideation to development and operation. Together with our partners and customers, we create value through exceptional user experiences and business-enhancing services and products.

We are seeking a UX Designer Expert to join our UX team on an exciting journey ahead. Our team comprises approximately 30 highly skilled designers dedicated to delivering world-class user experiences for our digital products. Designers are integral to all customer-facing developments, providing design expertise to product teams while collaborating with product owners, business analysts, developers, and stakeholders.

**Main Responsibilities:**

* Champion end-users by gaining a deep understanding of their work and challenges through quantitative and qualitative research to generate actionable insights.
* Facilitate workshops with stakeholders and product teams to gather knowledge, generate ideas, and design solutions.
* Set effect goals for products, formalize hypotheses, and measure success post-launch.
* Create user flows, wireframes, mock-ups, and prototypes optimized for various devices and interfaces, ensuring intuitive user experiences.
* Deliver detailed UI designs for products and development teams.
* Contribute to improving the team’s design practices and guide colleagues in enhancing their design thinking capabilities.

**Who You Are:**

* Strongly user-focused, driven by curiosity, and passionate about user-centered experience design.
* Skilled in balancing business goals, user needs, and technical requirements.
* Adept at handling high-level vision and service design as well as detailed execution.
* An innovative problem solver and collaborative team player.
* Self-driven, confident in leading discussions and workshops, with a proactive and energetic attitude.
* Experienced in graphic/visual design, usability research, and designing complex user workflows.
* Familiar with designing software and digital services, with an interest in the transportation industry.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.

**Expert: position typically requires 10 years or more relevant experience**

**Additional Details:**

* **Job Posting Start Date:** 2025-01-13
* **Location:** Göteborg
* **Office Presence:** At least 50% in the office.

Please note, I will not proceed with your application unless you provide me the following information:  
1. CV  
2. How many years of relevant experience you have

title: IT Product Owner for Digital Sales & Credit
description:
*Mercedes-Benz Finans Sweden AB and Denmark A/S offer financial services for both B2B and B2C for Mercedes-Benz vehicles. We are part of the Mercedes-Benz Group and have a joint Swedish-Danish organization, with our headquarter located in the Öresund region.*


Can you envision yourself in an exciting and independent role at one of the world's leading automotive and mobility providers? Does innovation and continuous development in a state-of-the-art tech stack motivate you? If so, the position of IT Product Owner in a modern DevOps Cloud environment might be your next career step.


**About the Position**


As the IT Product Owner, you will manage and develop technical solutions for Mercedes-Benz Finance's digital sales and lending model in Sweden and Denmark. Our digital sales and lending model is a strategic focus and a passion for new technology is essential. You will be part of a diverse team and work closely with both colleagues and stakeholders in Sweden and Denmark and the global Mercedes-Benz IT Tech Experts to create inspiring and sustainable solutions.


**Key Responsibilities**


* Transform business requirements into cutting-edge technical specifications.
* Deliver innovative technical solutions through configuration or by leading solution delivery from vendors/partners.
* Critically evaluate and review solution proposals from vendors/partners.
* Own the end-to-end product and technical landscape, ensuring long-term viability and future-proofing changes.
* Serve as the key liaison for central tech stack innovations and legacy integrations.
* Drive and deliver projects, change initiatives, governance, and support for live solutions.
* Implement groundbreaking solutions and features in AZURE Cloud environments.
* Ensure robust operations, modern application management, and cost monitoring.

**Qualifications**


* Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field.
* Strong background in application management in cloud environments.
* Fluent in English.
* Several years of professional experience in similar roles.
* You have in-depth knowledge of agile software development, including the use of necessary tools (e.g., Confluence, Jira, Mural, Mattermost).
* Knowledge of the financial or insurance industry is a plus.

**Core Competencies**


* Strong analytical and structured thinking with excellent communication skills.
* Passion for future-proof technical solutions.
* Deep understanding of business processes and the ripple effects of changes across the process chain.
* Meticulous attention to detail and a commitment to delivering on promises.
* Knowledge of system development and fundamental programming principles.
* Basic understanding of data protection and cybersecurity.

**Relevant Technical Skills**


* AZURE Cloud Fundamental certifications
* DevOps Expierence
* JavaScript – basic/intermediate
* SQL – basic
* HTML – basic

**Travel**


This role involves minimal travel, with occasional trips to our office in Copenhagen. We offer a hybrid work model, allowing for partial remote work.


Ready to make an impact and shape the future of digital sales and lending? Join us and be part of an exciting, innovative journey! Last day to apply is Jan 22nd.


If you have questions about this position, do not hesitate to reach out to André Schwarz, Manager Digital Solutions: andre.schwarz@mercedes-benz.com/+46 40 660 92 26.


If you have questions about the recruitment process, do not hesitate to reach out to Johanna Persson, HR: Johanna.persson@mercedes-benz.com/+46 76 105 57 98.


  

*We will perform a background check on the final candidate of this recruitment process. If you have any questions related to this, please reach out to the HR contact listed above.*


**What we stand for**

*Our commitment to inspire our customers with best-in class mobility services is what makes us a special company. No matter the continent, unit or product - the luxury claim accompanies our employees from the very beginning.*


*We offer our employees a wide range of benefits, such as "birthday day-off", pension & insurances, a benefits portal and whenever possible - flexible working hours.*


*At Mercedes-Benz Finans, we actively work with goal setting, feedback and continuous learning in order to achieve an organizational culture where individuals feel valued and engaged.*

*Are you ready to pass on your commitment and aspirations to our customers? Imagine it. Do it. Live it. Let's shape our culture together!*

title: Driftledare, Fastighetsavdelningen
description:
Generell information


Sista ansökningsdag
**2025-01-13**
Arbetsplats
**Norrbottens län**
Kommun
**Boden**
Yrkeskategori
**Driftchef, fastighet**
Anställningsform
**Tillsvidareanställning**
Omfattning
**Heltid**
Antal tjänster
**1**
Kontaktperson**Jonas Johansson**Avdelningschef 0921-62060  

  

Facklig företrädare**Jerry Larsson**
Kommunal 0921-62200  


Om arbetsplatsen


Vill du vara med och bidra till satsningarna kring vår tids största utmaningar, och kunna påverka och lämna över något för framtida generationer att vidareutveckla? Då är Bodens Kommun en arbetsgivare för dig!  

  

Boden ligger i Norrbottens kustland, endast 3 mil från havet mellan två älvdalar. Här bor cirka 28 000 personer. Boden är en modern småstad med närhet till det mesta vilket skapar ett givande arbets- och fritidsliv, det vi kallar närhetsliv.  

  

Boden ligger i hjärtat av en etableringsintensiv region och är en viktig del av den gröna globala samhällsomställningen. Här skapas ett samhälle i tillväxt, rustat för att möta den gröna ny industrialiseringen, med smarta och hållbara lösningar för samverkan, boende, transporter, vardagen och ett modernt företagande.
  

  

Med ett starkt stöd från kompetenta kollegor och chefer, får du mod att våga prova. Hos oss får du stort förtroende i en fantastisk miljö, där det finns möjlighet att utveckla dig själv och andra.  

  

Vill du veta mer om hur det är att jobba i Bodens kommun? Då kan du läsa mer här: www.boden.se/jobbaiboden  

  

Samhällsbyggnadsförvaltningen ska med framåtanda tillgängliggöra, underhålla, förvalta och utveckla kommunens fysiska miljö, infrastruktur och transporter. Förvaltningen arbete genomsyras av samarbete, helhetssyn och effektivt resursutnyttjande. Genom god planering bidrar förvaltningen till en attraktiv livsmiljö som är långsiktigt hållbar ur såväl ekologiskt som social och ekonomisk synpunkt.  

  

Samhällsbyggnadsförvaltningens består av följande verksamhetsområden; Fysisk planering, Vatten, avlopp och avfall, Gator, park och skog och Fastigheter, Miljö och bygg. Enheten för Projekt och investering driver och samordnar förvaltningens ny- och reinvesteringar.  

  

Fastighetsavdelningens huvudsakliga uppgift är att på Samhällsbyggnadsnämndens uppdrag tillhandahålla kostnads- och drifteffektiva lokaler för den kommunala verksamheten. Avdelningen ska ge den kommunala verksamheten service i fastighetsfrågor och samordna kommunens lokalplanering. Därutöver erbjuder avdelningen service i form av lokalvård och vaktmästeri till kommunens övriga förvaltningar. Driftsenheten ansvarar för underhåll, tillsyn och skötsel i och kring kommunens fastigheter i form av reparationer, utvändig skötsel mm. Vi är en liten organisation och har därmed korta beslutsvägar där du får stort förtroende och eget ansvar.


Arbetsuppgifter


Fastighetsförvaltningen söker nu en ny driftledare för felanmälan. Som driftledare ansvarar du för att processen för felanmälan fungerar på ett bra sätt för kunder och besökare. Det är även driftledarens roll att stödja förvaltningsorganisationen med övrigt administrativt arbete kopplat till driften.  

  

I rollen som driftledare ingår bland annat att:  

* Ansvara för mottagning av felanmälningar via telefon, mail och ev. besök samt ev registering i IT-stöd
* Ansvara för fördelning av uppdrag till drifttekniker, fastighetsskötare, driftstöd samt i förekommande fall entreprenörer och leverantörer
* Följa upp felavhjälpning och bistå vid upprättande av underlag till planerat underhåll
* Ansvara för upprätthållande av IT-stöd samt utbildning av medarbetare i systemet
* Prioritera felavhjälpning och driftlarm
Kvalifikationer


Vi söker dig med eftergymnasial utbildning inom fastighet och drift eller dokumenterad erfarenhet som bedöms likvärdig. God erfarenhet av arbete med installationer är ett krav såväl som erfarenhet av arbete i fastighets- och servicesektorn.  

  

Tjänsten innebär kommunikation med många externa och interna kontakter varför det är viktigt att du har förmågan att uttrycka dig väl i såväl tal och skrift, samt att du hanterar Office-paket som en naturlig del i ditt arbete. Erfarenhet av arbete med fastighetssystem är meriterande.  

Personliga egenskaper som vi efterfrågar är:  

* Självgående - Tar ansvar för sin uppgift. Strukturerar själv sitt angreppssätt och driver sina processer vidare.
* Samarbetsförmåga - Arbetar bra med andra människor. Kommunicerar på ett lyhört, konstruktivt och smidigt sätt.
* Stabil - Är lugn och trygg i sin roll. Behåller ett realistiskt perspektiv på situationer och har förmåga att fokusera på rätt saker.
* Serviceinriktad - Är uppmärksam och tillmötesgående i sitt beteende. Har intresse, vilja och förmåga att hjälpa andra samt anstränger sig i att leverera lösningar.
* Kvalitetsmedveten - Är noggrann, strukturerad och väl medveten om mål och kvalitetsstandard.

  

B - körkort är ett krav.  

  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
Anställningens omfattning


Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.


Ansökan


Referensnummer: C227076

  

Övrigt


Vi värdesätter en jämn ålders- och könsfördelning samt mångfald inom alla yrkesområden.  

  

Vi har rökfri arbetstid. Vi erbjuder en friskvårdstimme i veckan och ett friskvårdsbidrag. Via vår hälsoportal kan du som medarbetare boka in dig på olika friskvårdsaktiviteter ex massage, prova-på-träning, föreläsningar mm.  

  

Följ oss gärna på Facebook och Instagram  

  

När du söker jobb hos oss vill vi att du använder vårt e-rekryteringssystem.  

  

Frågor om tjänsten besvaras av kontaktpersonerna i annonsen.  

  

Vi tackar vänligt men bestämt nej till all kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.

title: Sales Manager – Next-Gen Penetration Testing
description:
**Who We Are** 





 Nordic Defender is a pioneering cybersecurity company offering a Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) model that redefines security. We do it through global crowdsourcing. We deliver comprehensive offensive services, including bug bounty programs, next-generation penetration testing, and vulnerability assessments tailored for mid-size tech companies. Our platform connects top-tier security researchers with businesses, providing scalable, flexible solutions that empower businesses of all sizes. Come and join us in building a secure future with innovative, customer-centric cybersecurity solutions!
 




  





**We are on a  Mission to Redefine Cybersecurity** 





 We’re on the hunt for a dynamic Sales Manager who’s not just passionate about sales but driven by a purpose: to make the cyber world safer while accelerating our growth. If you’re excited to be at the forefront of innovation and make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you!
 




  





 Why Join Us?
 
* Mission-Driven Innovation: Be part of a team prioritizing cybersecurity innovation to protect businesses and their critical assets.
* Growth and Learning: Thrive in an environment where learning never stops. We invest in our team’s professional development.
* Flexible Work Environment: Embrace a digital-first lifestyle with opportunities for remote work and collaborative team support.
* Empowered Leadership: Take full ownership of your business pipeline and make a measurable impact.



 Key Responsibilities
 


 As the Sales Manager, you will:
 




  




* Develop and execute strategic sales plans to target mid-size tech companies for our penetration testing services.
* Own the full sales cycle: prospecting, pipeline building, negotiation, and closing deals.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with decision-makers at all levels, including C-level executives.
* Work collaboratively with technical teams to tailor solutions that meet client needs.
* Accurately track and report on sales activities, forecasts, and outcomes using CRM tools.
* Continuously learn and stay updated on cybersecurity trends and solutions, becoming a trusted advisor for clients.



 What We’re Looking For
 


 Skills & Qualifications:
 




  




* Proven experience in high-velocity sales environments with a focus on IT or cybersecurity solutions.
* Strong ability to build and manage relationships with decision-makers, especially in technical settings.
* A track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets in B2B environments.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills, both online and in-person.
* Familiarity with CRM tools and pipeline management.




 Preferred:
 




  




* Sales experience with IT security or penetration testing.
* Understanding of cybersecurity trends and challenges faced by tech companies.
* Knowledge of Nordic languages is a plus, with proficiency in English being essential.



 Who You Are
 
* Driven and Proactive: You take initiative, thrive on challenges, and are committed to exceeding expectations.
* Innovative Problem-Solver: You excel at identifying customer needs and crafting tailored solutions.
* Collaborative and Resilient: You’re a true team player who navigates complex sales cycles with persistence.
* Ethical and Trustworthy: You uphold the highest standards of integrity in every client interaction.



 Ready to Take the Next Step?
 


 Join us at Nordic Defender, where your passion for sales and cybersecurity can make a real difference. Help mid-size tech companies secure their digital future while growing their career in a dynamic, supportive environment.
 




  






 Apply today and become part of the team that’s reshaping cybersecurity!

title: Do you want to be part of the most important Change journey in Scania?
description:
**Project Manager to E2E Redesign Program Office, KVDP**
 Are you challenged by the unexplored and see the possibilities in breaking new grounds?
   

  

 Are you excited of being able to impact Scania’s future way of working?
   

  

  

* Then Global Integrated Business Planning is the place for you!


 The E2E Redesign Program was established by ExBoard with the ambition to create a radical step change for Scania’s E2E Flow. We are a part of KV, the Global Integrated Business Planning organization (prev. Demand to Cash Management) within Sales & Marketing at Scania. KV is responsible for Scania’s Integrated Business Planning process (IBP) as well as the core process Order to Delivery (O2D) and Operational planning. Our vision is to sustain a stable delivery flow and achieve corporate targets, ensuring that customers trust Scania’s delivery capability.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Project manager to join our team and be part of our E2E Redesign Program.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We offer you a wide, challenging and developing position in an exciting and dynamic environment as a part of our E2E Redesign PMO. The position will expose you to a wide range of skilled people from different parts of the Scania organization as well as Scania Executive Board. You will be involved in both the Order to Delivery process and Integrated Business Planning process. You will also get an in-depth understanding of the overall value created for Scania and our customers through our cross-functional work in planning and flow development.
   

  

 As a Project Manager you will be responsible to drive and coordinate specific program initiatives and/or workstreams to achieve set deliverables and milestones. You will define and manage involvement of required cross-functions and experts to execute on activities supporting the overall program target. In this role you will be reporting progress, deviations and success both to the PMO as well as our Steering Committee and Scania Executive Board.
   

  

 You will also be part of the PMO Project Team and Core Team aligning with other workstreams and initiatives to secure deliverables are on time, support in preparations for the meetings and be an active part of developing the program (e.g., new initiatives, changes to current set-up).
   

  

**Your Profile**
 We are looking for a high-performing individual with strong ambitions and drive. You are self-motivated and highly organized with the ability of tackling problems from a big-picture perspective. To succeed in this role we see that you have high analytical ability and are able to explain and communicate complex matters in an easy and understandable way for people not familiar with the details. It is natural for you to interact with persons in various positions within the company, and lay strategies to communicate project status and needed actions regularly. You have a positive attitude with a high level of responsibility. It is beneficial if you enjoy process development and when faced with challenges you know how to use established methods, but are also curious and daring to try unknown methods and approaches to reach a result.
   

  

 You have a relevant academic degree for the job and are fluent in English. You have experience in project management and from leading projects. Experience from working across the Scania processes connected to O2D in various cross-functions (R&D, Sales and Marketing, Production and Logistics, Procurement, and Commercial Operations) is highly valuable.
   

  

**Application**
 Please submit you application latest by 19 January.

title: After Sales Consultant
company_industry: Motor Vehicle Manufacturing, Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Role:** 
 After Sales Consultant
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Hybrid:** 
 2-3 days on the field
 



**Contract:** 
 Permanent
 



  





**ABOUT OUR COMPANY** 




 At MICHELIN Connected Fleet, a division of the Michelin Group, leaders in sustainable mobility for 130 years, we specialise in connected fleet management services and solutions. We are a market leader with over 30 years expertise in a high-growth and competitive mobility tech industry. Today we work with 70,000 customers and over 600,000 vehicles globally, growing more than 10% per year, and entering on average 3 new markets a year. Backed by Michelin Group and operating under the Michelin Connected Fleet name, we will be a major player in this market in the coming years.
 



  





**OUR PEOPLE & WAYS OF WORKING** 




 At MICHELIN Connected Fleet, agility is not a word - it’s a lifestyle. We gather entrepreneurial minds who are not afraid to fail fast and learn quickly, every day. We think long term and act short term, we grow fast and love what we do. We believe in an inclusive working environment, building teams with a variety of backgrounds, skills, views and opinions. Among our 400 employees in Europe, we proudly benefit from around 30 nationalities. We thrive because of the diverse background and talent of our people. We nurture our team's growth with several company wide development programs - including our Diversity, Mentoring and Sustainability programs.
 



  





**THE ROLE IN SHORT** 




 Michelin Connected Fleet is looking for a dynamic and motivated After Sales professional who can build outstanding relationships with our customers in Sweden. The Aftersales professional will have the responsibility to run pilots with potential customers, identifying their pain-points and solving these with our solutions. The After Sales professional will also be responsible for managing a number of live customer accounts, ensuring that customers extract as much value from the solutions as possible.
 



  





**What would your role look like:** 




**Pre-sales activity:** 




 Support pre-sales activity to define the solution that fits the customer's needs best.
 



 As such, analyse customer needs, compatibility checks, and salesforce validation.
 



 Support the sales team presenting details / functionalities and benefits of the system.
 



  





**Customer Pilots:** 




 Define the objective, scope and success criteria of pilots, alongside the customer.
 



 Perform the kickoff meeting with the customer and main stakeholders.
 



 Manage the pilot with regular customer contact, advancing through the pilot methodology, focusing on closing the deal.
 



 Perform training for the customer and drivers based on the pilot objectives.
 



 Present the results of the pilot to the customer.
 



  





**After sales:** 




 Continuous targeting of need improvement and opportunities.
 



 Provide good practices of usage of the solution between customers and proactively provide insights on features adoption.
 



 Solve customers problems of the usage of the solution.
 



 Retention of the customer on any sign of dissatisfaction.
 



 Work in close cooperation with colleagues from other cross functional teams to leverage skills and seek buy in where appropriate to maximise sales success
 



  





**To be successful you will likely have:** 



* Live in the Stockholm region and willingness to travel on business 2-3 days per week and occasionally stay overnight in the area and the region.
* University degree
* Fluent/Native Swedish
* Fluent English
* 3-4 years experience working in a similar role
* Experience working in services industry (ideally technology focused), knowing how important it is to understand customer needs and add value



  





**What we offer:** 



* Full term employment
* Flexible working
* Attractive remuneration with variable components
* Company car incl. private use
* 30 days holidays to recharge your batteries A wide range of career and further development opportunities, e.g. through internal training courses and seminars
* A well-structured onboarding process and individual training



  





 Work-life balance is important to us at Michelin Connected Fleet, so we offer our teams as much flexibility as possible in line with the needs of their role. We trust our teams to know how they work best, combining remote and collaborative working, with a flexible approach to hours. This allows our people the time and space for life outside of work.

title: Informationssäkerhetsspecialist Stockholm
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Vi vill vara det självklara valet för dig som vill arbeta med arbetslöshetsförsäkringen och lägger därför kraft på att skapa en god arbetsmiljö och förmånliga anställningsvillkor.
   

  

 Som medarbetare på Unionens a-kassa kan vi bland annat erbjuda dig:
   

  

* marknadsmässig lön
* ett riktigt bra kollektivavtal med bland annat generös avsättning till tjänstepension och minst 33 dagar semester per år
* ett friskvårdsbidrag på 4 500 kronor per år
* arbetstider med flexibilitet under ansvar
* en friskvårdstimme per vecka, hälsoinspiratörer och möjlighet till massage på kontoret
* möjlighet att delvis arbeta hemifrån
* goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter


 Vi är cirka 300 anställda som sitter i fina lokaler centralt i Malmö, på Södermalm i Stockholm och i centrala Örebro. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att främja mångfald och inkludering i vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av Unionens arbetslöshetskassa och vara 100 procent viktig varje dag?
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som informationssäkerhetspecialist ansvarar du för att planera vårt informationssäkerhetsarbete och samordnar med IT-säkerhetsarbetet på arbetsplatsen. Du stödjer ansvariga i verksamheten för att säkra hanteringen av information och informationstillgångar. Du förebygger och upptäcker säkerhetsrisker samt utvärderar och följer upp resultat och efterlevnad. I arbetet ingår även att informera och utbilda verksamheten för att möjliggöra ett säkert användande av digitala tjänster, samt säkerställa att vi följer lagstiftning och andra krav.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna innebär rent praktiskt att:
   

  

* införa och utveckla ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet, och kontinuerligt rapportera om status till ledningen
* bidra i arbetet med att ta fram risk- och sårbarhetsanalyser samt hantera och vara ett stöd vid informationssäkerhetsincidenter
* ansvara för verksamhetens dokumentation och rutiner inom området samt bidra till närliggande områden
* bidra i arbete med leverantörer, övriga tredjepartsföretag, andra externa parter och samarbetspartners
* omvärldsbevaka inom eget ansvarsområde.


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av informationssäkerhetsarbete och kunskap om gällande standarder och lagstiftningar på området
* erfarenhet av att ha implementerat ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet
* akademisk utbildning eller likvärdig utbildning
* erfarenhet av arbete på en a-kassa eller annan liknande organisation.


 Du är målfokuserad, tänker strategiskt och ser till hela verksamhetens bästa i agerande och beslut. Du har en god förmåga att arbeta självständigt, men är även lyhörd och samarbetar väl med andra. Du har förståelse för människors olika förutsättningar och ett pedagogiskt sätt att förmedla ditt budskap till mottagare. Du har även goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Arbetsmarknaden förändras i allt snabbare takt och arbetslöshetskassornas uppdrag har kanske aldrig varit viktigare. Vi på Unionens a-kassa brinner för det här uppdraget.
   

  

 Unionens a-kassa är den näst största arbetslöshetskassan i Sverige med nästan 750 000 medlemmar. Vi fattar beslut i ärenden om medlemskap och arbetslöshetsersättning enligt lagen om arbetslöshetskassor (LAK) och lagen om arbetslöshetsförsäkring (ALF). Arbetslöshetsförsäkringen är en omställningsförsäkring vid arbetslöshet och vårt arbete påverkar många människors vardag.
   

  

 Våra ledord är kvalitet, effektivitet, tillgänglighet och engagemang, och vår vision är att vara det självklara valet!

title: Custom Engineer
description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
   

  

****Job Description****
 SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
   

  

**Job Description**
 SS&C Advent
   

  

 SS&C Advent is an independent business unit of SS&C Technologies and a leading provider of award-winning software and services for the investment management industry worldwide. Our 4000+ clients across 50+ countries include asset managers, wealth managers, banks, family offices, fund managers, fund administrators and prime brokers. Our solutions streamline their processes for portfolio management, trading and order management, compliance, portfolio accounting, performance analytics, reporting and more.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a talented and motivated person to join our team at SS&C Advent as a Software Engineering Consultant.
   

  

 In this role, you will help our clients across Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia Pacific optimize business workflows, by creating, delivering and supporting any customizations they need to bridge our technology with their unique requirements. You will collaborate closely with the client to gather requirements and provide detailed specifications, to ensure delivery meets their expectations. This work includes consulting, analysis, development and quality assurance.
   

  

 SS&C Advent provides training, covering the securities industry, database and networking technologies as well as our portfolio management and reporting products, including tools used for creating customizations. Once settled in you will work closely with our clients and the entire team at SS&C Advent, across business functions and regions. The work is rewarding, yet presents new challenges every day. It requires fast pace and ability to adapt to challenges and priorities as needed.
   

  

 This is a unique opportunity to blend financial industry knowledge with technology skills, in a vibrant, international work environment. You get to tap into the knowledge of leading financial institutions as well as our experienced team, to learn and develop skills that will ultimately help you progress your career, and grow a solid network within the fin-tech industry.
   

  

 The work will be out of our Stockholm office, with the possibility to work from home a few days a week.
   

  

 Your Responsibilities
   

  

* Provide custom engineering services for clients across EMEA and APAC regions, covering modification and development of software specified by the services organization.
* Assist SS&C Advent’s services organization by sharing knowledge of software development skill sets and providing consultancy.
* Create technical documentation for custom engineering items.
* Support items already developed and delivered.
* Train and learn on product changes and new technologies relevant to building custom engineering items.
* Manage and utilize outsourcing resources.
* Manage custom solution project deliverables in implementation projects.


 Your experience
   

  

* 3+ years of relevant working experience in C# developing.
* Experience with Microsoft SQL server (T-SQL, ADO .NET, database tools, etc).
* Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services is a plus.
* Fluent in one of the Scandinavian language.
* Experience in the fintech industry is a plus.


 Our Culture
   

  

 At SS&C Advent, you will find a rewarding career where you can thrive at every level. We are proud of our unique business culture, founded on the passion of our people, dedicated to the success of our clients. As a company, we reward innovation and professionalism, and support personal development. We invest in our employees through offering competitive compensation and benefits, comprehensive training opportunities, and employee programs to promote a healthy work-life balance and personal well-being.
   

  

 Our culture thrives on teamwork and diversity. Therefore, we hope to see you bring your unique perspective and talent to SS&C Advent, and thrive!
   

  

 Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services.
   

  

 SS&C offers excellent benefits including health, tuition and professional development reimbursement plan. SS&C Technologies is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any applicant for employment or employee on the basis of race, color, religious creed, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by applicable discrimination laws.
   

  

**EEO Statement / Non-agency Disclosure**
 We encourage applications from people of all backgrounds and particularly welcome applications from under-represented groups, to enable us to bring a diversity of perspectives to our thinking and conversation. It's important to us that we strive to have a workforce that is diverse in the widest sense.
   

  

 Unless explicitly requested or approached by SS&C Technologies, Inc. or any of its affiliated companies, the company will not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services.

title: TRAINING PLANNER
description:
**SAS is looking for a Training Planner, Resource Management**
 We are driven by passion and purpose: ingenuity and creativity are central to our work, whilst at the same time we always have our customers overall experience and safety in mind. SAS is Scandinavia’s leading airline with destinations in Europe, USA, and Asia. We are now looking for a training planner who wants to be part of and contribute to SAS continues success. Send in your application today!
   

  

 Resource Management is a central function within an airline and has the overall responsibility for ensuring that all SAS flights are manned. Resource Management consists of about 40 individuals, and the department has five units. Three optimization units, one unit responsible for crew related data and one responsible for training planning. Each team consist of 5-10 employees and team leader.
   

  

 As a Training Planner you will take part in the planning of our airlines crew’s training, you will create and follow up on our training plans and keep a constant dialog with the training departments of our airlines. The work is performed in several of our systems, and especially in our Crew Management System from Jeppesen. Communication is key and you will be in dialog with internal and external stakeholders for you to be able to optimize the training through the whole planning chain.
   

  

 You will, together with your great colleagues, work on our processes and procedures to be able to continuously improve the training planning, to keep flight safety our main priority as well as to make it even better from crew’s perspective and to improve efficiency by always keeping focus on cost. It is an important process where you will be able to use your experience, creativity and skills and quickly see the result.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Plan and replan the need for training for our cabin and flight deck crew in Crew Management System
* Document and develop our ways of working internally in Resource Management as well as together with our internal Training Departments
* Follow up on our Key Performance Indicators
* Ensure that all training demand is communicated to internal and external stakeholders.


**Who are you?**
 We put great emphasis on you as a person and what you can bring to the team as a professional and as a colleague – you are engaging, and you join our effort to have fun at work.
   

  

 We are primarily looking for you who have previous experience from a similar field (e.g. crew planning, training planning, crew training, people logistics etc., either from the airline industry or another relevant industry) or have an academic background, preferably in logistics.
   

  

 You are an experienced Microsoft Office user with a good background in Excel. You are fluent in written and spoken English and it is highly meriting if you understand the Scandinavian languages.
   

  

 You are structured, responsible, and keep track also of details while at the same time keep the wider perspective. You are not afraid to ask for help when needed and at the same time you’re happy to support your colleagues when they need support.
   

  

**Desired Qualifications And Skills**
* Previous relevant experience (e.g. crew planning, training planning, crew training, people logistics etc., either from the airline industry or another relevant industry)
* Knowledge of Jeppesen CMS-suite and good understanding of flight safety and FTL/OM-A is highly meriting
* Good analytical skills
* Dynamic, outgoing and high degree of drive
* Good communication skills both written and oral
* Fully proficient in Office 365 with focus on Excel


**Other Of Importance**
 The position is located at SAS Frösundavik. Some business travel is to be expected. Start date is as soon as possible. For more info contact: Head of Training Planning Carl Malmerhag, carl.malmerhag@sas.se
   

  

 The selection process will start after the holidays, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found so please do not hesitate to apply for this very interesting position!
