**Take the next step in your career by sending your CV and a brief cover letter to** 
 join@multiply.tech
 



 Let’s create the future of business transformation together!

title: CTO till Cirkus Venues
description:
*Vill du driva och leda teknologisk innovation i en dynamisk och kreativ miljö? Som CTO hos Cirkus Venues får du möjligheten att kombinera tekniskt ledarskap med strategiskt tänkande för att forma framtidens upplevelser inom hotell- och arenaverksamhet.*
**Din vardag**
 Som CTO hos Cirkus Venues kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att säkerställa att teknologin stödjer våra affärsmål och förbättrar gäst- och besökarupplevelsen. Din vardag kommer att vara varierad och dynamisk, och du kommer att:
   

  

* Utveckla och implementera tekniska strategier som stödjer både hotell- och arenaverksamhetens affärsmål.
* Leda och motivera IT-teknikteamet för att säkerställa hög prestanda och kundnöjdhet i allt från den dagliga verksamheten till affärsdrivna förändringsprojekt.
* Bevaka, utvärdera och integrera relevanta nya teknologier och system för att förbättra gäst- och besökarupplevelsen.
* Samarbeta med andra avdelningar för att identifiera och lösa tekniska utmaningar.
* Säkerställa att alla tekniska lösningar är säkra och följer gällande regler och standarder.
* På ledningens uppdrag säkerställa optimal cyber- och infosäkerhet.


 Genom att ta en aktiv roll i allt från strategisk planering till operativt genomförande bidrar du till att Cirkus Venues fortsätter vara en innovativ och ledande aktör i branschen.
   

  

 Rollen innefattar personal- och budgetansvar. Du rapporterar till CFO och utgår från vårt kontor på Djurgården i Stockholm.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:
   

  

* Har bakgrund inom IT och teknik i en roll som gett dig goda ledarerfarenheter.
* Relevant utbildning inom området eller motsvarande erfarenhet.
* Har erfarenhet av systematiskt datasäkerhetsarbete, inklusive Information Security Management System (ISMS), GDPR och ISO 27001.
* Har god kunskap om Microsofts lösningar inom 365 och säkerhet (SOC).
* Har stark förmåga att leda team och kommunicera effektivt på alla nivåer.
* Är strategiskt tänkande och har erfarenhet av att lösa komplexa problem.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera personal, budget och resurser på ett effektivt sätt.
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 Som person är du engagerad, analytisk och strukturerad med en naturlig förmåga att skapa förtroende och engagemang hos dina medarbetare. Du har ett framåtblickande perspektiv och kan prioritera både operativa och strategiska mål i en föränderlig miljö.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Hos Cirkus Venues lever vi för att skapa enastående och minnesvärda upplevelser och vi kan med stolthet säga att vi är riktigt bra på det.
   

  

 Cirkus Venues består av Cirkus Arena & Restaurang, Hotell Hasselbacken, Backstage Hotel och Konsthallen Café och Restaurang samt Pop Story och The Visitor, alla belägna på Kungliga Djurgården i Stockholm. År 2027 öppnas även Stockholms nya Kulturscen Gasometer i norra Djurgårdsstaden.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Cirkus Venues med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Anja Widell på anja.widell@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess genomför vi bakgrundskontroller på vår slutkandidat. Innan en bakgrundskontroll genomförs kommer du ombedjas ge ditt samtycke.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande, välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Business Development Manager
description:
**About XBP Europe**
 XBP Europe is an innovative, forward-thinking provider of bills and payment process solutions. Leveraging an EMEA-wide footprint and proprietary technology and services, we are backed by decades of industry-relevant experience.
   

  

 Bills and payment processes are increasingly omni-channel and paperless. That’s where XBP Europe comes in. Our offerings enable seamless workflows and frictionless transactions. XBP Europe combines physical documents, digital data, and instant messaging to help organisations work smarter. As part of that, we help to gather, process, and refine valuable data for use in decision-making.
   

  

 Our digital transformation solutions enhance efficiency, cash flow, and end-user experience. We serve a growing client list throughout Europe. See why organisations of all sizes choose XBP Europe as a digital transformation partner, visit our website at www.xbpeurope.com
   

  

**Job Description**
 Business Development Manager (Hybrid)
   

  

 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Job Purpose**
* Deliver support to the Northern Europe Sales organization during the sales and bid process and act as the project (bid) owner in providing solution proposals, functional specifications and pricing estimates to meet customer requirements.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide alignment of proposal with Operations, Business Solution Group, IT and other departments involved e.g. HR, Finance.
* Analyze and reflect customer business requirements for both solutions and services we want to provide
* In conjunction with Sales team, provide professional presentations or demonstrations for clients addressing specific business cases
* Support operational/delivery excellence through precise requirements delivery for implementation of solutions/services
* Meet with assigned clients when needed and perform an initial assessment of a problematic or required situation to ensure comprehensive requirements are gathered for new opportunities good understanding of requirements and objective of customer.
* Engage with solution and deal teams to get business cases decribed and calculated
* Support new solution/service enablement by identifying potential business cases and defining matching services for the markets in scope
* Support business strategy to ensure customer and revenue growth.
* Ensure quality of bids and functional specifications
* Professional bid management (driving the completion of timely offer submission)
* Identify cross- and upselling opportunities together with Sales and Strategic Deal Teams
* Together with Business Strategy, identify and define new solutions and services creating new business opportunities
* The employee is required to undertake any task for which they have been trained, have suitable qualifications and or experience as deemed by a member of management.


**Key Requirements**
* A self-starter who can easily motivate themselves.
* Ability to lead and manage virtual teams to deliver quality outcomes within agreed timeframes.
* A committed, organised, confident, consistent and ambitious person.
* 5-10 years’ experience in customer management, presales and/or design of complex customer solutions
* Strong business acumen and technical aptitude in the markets and technologies XBP Europe is focusing on
* Business Development experience and aware of the future impacts of technology on business operations.
* Ability to quickly build trusting relationships with clients.
* Expert at uncovering client needs, developing compelling propositions and building comprehensive financials models and business cases.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills.
* Experience building hi-level customer relationships with both technical and business contacts.
* Evidence of flexibility and accuracy.
* A client centric and an entrepreneurial thinker.
* Good knowledge of Financial Services and operations, including use of its technology.
* Exposure to commercial situations and a solid background in transforming operations using a variety of tools and techniques.
* Recognised certs that evidence strong communications skills and numeracy.
* Excellent language skills in Swedish and English. Norwegian and/or Danish is beneficial.
* Willing to travel within the Nordics.


**Our Offer**
* Working in a dynamically developing international company at the XBP Europe with global standards and systems.
* Individual Development Plan and career growth
* Social package and employee benefits of the corporate level:
* Permanent Contract
* Referral Bonus
* Annual Bonus Plan
* Medical Benefits
* Holiday entitlement
* Pension scheme


**Disclaimer**
 XBP Europe prioritizes individual privacy and is devoted to safeguarding personal data. Our recruitment policy focuses on selecting the most qualified candidates based on merit and skills aligned with position requirements. Candidate information is handled in strict compliance with GDPR policies and relevant data protection laws. Read our GDPR policy here.
   

  

 XBP Europe is committed to creating a diverse environment. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their characteristics or preferences. We provide equality, fairness and respect for all in our employment, whether temporary, part-time or full-time. We oppose and avoid all forms of unlawful discrimination including those known as protected characteristics.
   

  

 XBP Europe recruiters or representatives will only contact you by emails ending with xbpeurope.com or exelatech.com. We would never ask you for payment or ask you to deposit a check into your personal bank account during the recruitment process.

title: Head of Flower Hub - Technical product management
description:
**⚡️ What We Do**
 Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.
   

  

 With an industry-leading AI-powered platform at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.
   

  

**🌟Who We Are**
 Tech company at heart – purpose in our DNA. Flower consists of a diverse group of innovative individuals with a strong desire to improve the state of the world.
   

  

 At Flower, we believe trust, collaboration and diversity are essential to not only create an inclusive work environment, but also drive career growth. By embracing varying perspectives, we allow creativity and progress to flourish.
   

  

 To accelerate towards our goal of becoming the pioneering force powering the energy system of tomorrow, we are now looking for a passionate and skilled Head of Flower Hub to join the team.
   

  

 👩‍💻
 **About the Role**
 With our Flower hub product we connect residential batteries to the grid, enabling households to be part of the transition of the energy system through supporting the grid. The product integrates both hardware and software technology.
   

  

 As the leader of the Flower Hub squad, you will drive the technical and strategic development of our Flower Hub product. Your mission is to scale the product efficiently, balancing rapid innovation with process quality, all while ensuring a high level of user satisfaction.
   

  

 Your role as the squad manager encompasses a range of technical and managerial responsibilities:
   

  

* Providing strong leadership to guide and inspire the tech team.
* Developing and executing the squad’s strategic objectives, ensuring alignment with Flower’s overarching goals and translating them into actionable product roadmaps.
* Managing the squad's resources, including budgeting, capacity planning, and workload distribution.
* Fostering the professional growth of team members by supporting skill development and personal goals.
* Overseeing personnel management, including regular 1:1s, performance reviews, salary discussions, and development planning.
* Creating and maintaining a hiring plan, leading recruitment processes alongside the department VP.
* Collaborating with stakeholders to drive business development and strategic partnerships (directly or through designated account managers and business developers).
* Staying informed about advancements in energy storage technology, market trends, and regulatory changes to guide product development effectively.


 💡
 **Who You Are**
**Role**
 We are seeking a technically adept and visionary leader to take the Flower Hub to the next level. To succeed in this role, you should bring:
   

  

* A proactive, entrepreneurial mindset with a drive for innovation.
* A good technical knowledge to be able to fully understand your teams challenges.
* Proven experience in leading technical teams, scaling products, and managing complex projects.
* A track record of fostering team growth and individual development through your leadership.
* Strong skills in stakeholder management and partnership development.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.


**🌟What We Offer**
 Opportunity to be an entrepreneur leading a “startup within the startup” and bring this product to the next level. You will have a lot of freedom to implement your ideas, at the same time have the support from being a part of a larger company.
   

  

**📍 Location**
 Our office is located in the heart of Södermalm just a short walk from Slussen subway station. We encourage in-office collaboration but support a hybrid work model.
   

  

**🛒 Apply**
 To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and what you think you could bring to our team. Throughout the recruitment process you will meet with the People & Culture Partner, VP of Distributed Assets and our CEO John.
   

  

 Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office. We therefore appreciate it if you could submit your CV in English.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**Please note, we will start reviewing candidates at the end of January. Flower wish you a delightful holiday!**
*We kindly but firmly decline any engagement in recruitment assistance for our hiring processes. This includes partnership offers or the sale of recruitment tools.*

title: Senior Health & Safety Engineer for Scania Sweden.
description:
**Are you eager about fronting the development of Governance Safety for Scania Sweden** 
**and continuously improve our work environment?**
 Our vision is Scania Care – Zero Harm and our strategic objectives helps us to deliver our ambitious vision.
   

  

 We have an exciting opportunity to join Scania´s global HSE organisation for a role in the area of work environment management Sweden. The organisation has focus on governance within the field of HSE on corporate, global, and local levels – a world-wide scope for all businesses. The head office is located in Södertälje, but the organization is represented at the production sites in Oskarshamn, Luleå, within Zwolle in the Netherlands and Angers in France.
   

  

 We are in an exciting transformation so you will have great opportunities to influence our way of working.
   

  

**Company Overview**
 Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to being a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 At Scania CV AB we believe that change is essential for growth and innovation. As a leading company in our industry, we are committed to staying ahead of the curve and adapting to evolving market conditions. Our success is driven by our ability to effectively manage change and help our employees and stakeholders embrace new strategies, technologies, and processes.
   

  

**Position Overview**
 You will be part of a dedicated team where ideas and innovation are encouraged. We work together to find the best solutions and grow as individuals and as an organization. You will have a role in our team leading the work environment steering at Scania in Sweden. The team take lead, develope and coordinate within governance structure, statistic, reporting and compliance in the Swedish legislation.
   

  

**Some of the main responsibilities will include:**
* Develop, manage and maintenance the Scania's work environment process and handbook.
* Develop, manage and maintenance the legal compliance process for Sweden
* Work with ISO 45001
* Development and implementation of training
* Collaboration with working teams and Scania stakeholders, towards Our vision Scania Care – Zero Harm.
* Participate in internal networks and co-work within the Swedish and global structure.
* Collaborate with relevant industry colleagues and representing Scania in networks.
* Provide expert knowledge in compliance with current legislation, policy and methods together with the stakeholders ensuring adherence to relevant methods etc.
* Be a part of the communication of relevant information and material and guidelines via our intranet.
* Work with statistics


**Qualifications**
* Adequate education as a Work environment engineer, or corresponding in the field relevant for the position.
* Ability to work collaboratively and lead in cross-functional teams and manage multiple priorities.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels.
* Competence in ISO 45001 work environment management system standard
* Experience of forming organizational and administrative structures and processes.
* Experience in method development and processes.
* Competence in Swedish and European Health & Safety legislation.
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Meritorious**
* Good knowledge with relevant IT tools and pedagogical tools.


**Location:** 
 Sweden (Södertälje)
   

  

**How To Apply**
 Kindly apply as soon as possible, but no later than January 7th 2025, since selection and interviews will be held throughout the whole application period. Note that a background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

**For More Information About The Role Please Contact**
 Head of Governance Safety Mia Linder, mia.linder@scania.com

title: Manager People & Culture Business Partner -Nordics
description:
**Join us to deliver a smoke- free future as People & Culture Business Partner!**
 We’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business and building our future on one clear purpose – to deliver a smoke-free future. Swedish Match is an affiliate of PMI and have been a leader in the industry for more than 200 years.
   

  

 In the Nordic region, we are 1,600 employees based in Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway working in various functions and teams and together we are collaborating to deliver a smoke-free Nordics.
   

  

 The scale of our transformation means we’re effectively building a vast new business, at pace. In
 **P&C (People & Culture - our HR function** 
 ), we have a huge part to play, defining and shaping our new customer focused culture, organizing functions to work better together, and attracting the best talent with new types of skills to join us.
   

  

 We are looking for a People & Culture Business Partner who will be based in Stockholm and be responsible for driving the deployment of our People & Culture strategy and initiatives in the assigned business units / functional teams within the Nordics cluster. If you’re comfortable with ambiguity and excited by the challenge of shaping things, you’ll be in your element here. There’s endless space to develop too, so you’ll be progressing your career as fast as you build our smoke-free future.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Work with business leaders in assigned business units/functions and translate business strategies into organizational priorities and plans; identify future business demands/opportunities with a P&C aspect and deploy solutions that impact business success.
* Act as Change Enabler by providing proactive support to successfully plan and implement business transformations or other strategic organizational change programs.
* Based on current and future business needs, drive strategic talent planning in assigned business units/functional teams, deploy talent strategy sustaining a well-developed, diverse pipeline of talent delivering a strong succession for critical positions.
* Coach all levels of managers on people strategy, including organizational design, career development, coaching, recognition, performance management, etc.
* Develop a positive work environment in assigned departments through implementing effective interventions like cultural transformation, collaboration improvement, employee well-being, diversity and inclusion.
* Analyze and interpret key people data to identify trends and talent needs; communicate findings and recommendations to the business.
* Contribute to the development and roll-out of P&C policies and programs (e.g., talent, L&D, compensation, etc.).
* Ensure productive labor relations; assist people leaders with employee and labor relations matters, following company policies, employment laws, and standard processes.


**Requirements**
* Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in human resources, Business or Organization Development or equivalent.
* At least 6 years of experience in an HR Business Partnering role within multinational organizations, ideally for a multi-functional, multi-line-of-business organization.
* Exceptional internal client relationship management skills, experience in building relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders, ability to influence decision makers.
* Well-versed in HR fields: talent acquisition, talent management, performance management, organizational development, change management, learning and leadership development, employee engagement, etc.
* Strong project management and execution skills.
* Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze data, understand trends and develop recommendations for action.
* Sound knowledge of labor law, experience in trade unions negotiations.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Swedish.
* Advanced knowledge in MS Office applications.


**What We Offer**
 Our success depends on the dedicated people who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join us at Swedish Match and you too can:
   

  

* Seize the freedom to define your future and ours. We’ll empower you to take risks, experiment and explore.
* Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.
* Enjoy flexibility of hybrid way of working - split your time between working from our office or the comfort of your home, where it works best for you in line with business needs.
* Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.
* Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to deliver a smoke-free future.


 #SWMA
   

  

**621**

title: DIGITAL SERVICE OWNER AUTOMATION
description:
**Purpose**
 At SAS we are passionate about revolutionizing the aviation industry through cutting-edge technology. We aim to become Scandinavia's preferred airline with your help. As part of our automation team, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the future of air travel by advancing our automation strategy and ensuring the successful deployment of innovative solutions. To date, we have automated over 150 processes across multiple business units, having recently reached an impressive milestone of 800,000 hours returned to the business.
   

  

 If you’re excited about driving intelligent automation projects to enhance network efficiency, financial processes, flight operations, and customer experience, this role is for you!
   

  

**About The Team**
 SAS is dedicated to a true digital journey, leveraging data and technology to optimize and improve processes.
   

  

 We are a central automation team that collaborates closely with stakeholders across various business units, identifying business challenges and opportunities that can be addressed through automation.
   

  

 We work with diverse automation projects, collaborate and contribute to the automation practice to ensure that we have a solid foundation for SAS to scale and realize the full potential of automation.
   

  

 When we are not busy with supporting our business stakeholders, we are working with various activities to educate and inspire the business in automation transformation.
   

  

 To secure our future success we are now strengthening our team with a Digital Service Owner.
   

  

**Digital Service Owner within Automation**
 In this role, you’ll be engaging in diverse automation projects, managing resources, ensuring timely delivery of solutions, and driving continuous improvement to optimize workflows and meet business objectives.
   

  

 With most of our development performed offshore you will be responsible for enhancing our methods and practices to ensure the delivery of robust RPA solutions while adhering to regulatory requirements and IT security policies.
   

  

 As a key member in the team, you will collaborate closely with the RPA Lead and Head of AI to jointly drive our automation strategy.
   

  

 Alongside your core responsibilities, you’ll have the opportunity to explore various SAS domains, uncovering new automation opportunities.
   

  

 We believe you share our passion for innovation and efficiency. You are driven by the potential of automation to transform business processes, and you bring a commitment to quality and security. Your enthusiasm for exploring new ideas, uncovering valuable automation opportunities, and orchestrating the delivery and operations of solutions will play a crucial role in achieving our goals.
   

  

**To Be Successful, We Believe You Should Have**
* Master’s Degree in (Computer Science, Information systems) or related field
* At least 3 years of experience within automation technology (we use UIPath)
* Experienced in RPA lifecycle management (solution design, development, testing, deployment, change management)
* Experience from driving projects within an enterprise environment preferably with an automation and change management component
* Experience from process development
* Strong communication skills
* Experience with Agile/Scrum/Kanban methodologies is a plus


 We believe you share our passion efficiency and automation. You’re self-driven, persistent, creative, and curious, with a strong passion for learning. You seek to understand both the big picture and the intricate details that make it up. Like us, you get excited by commercial opportunities and proactively strive to create business value!
   

  

**Why SAS?**
**Benefits**
 At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:
   

  

* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Central Station, Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.


 If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply already today with your CV and a short personal letter. Last day for application is January 26th, 2025. For questions relating to this position, please contact hiring manager warren.edgren@sas.se.

title: Global Account Manager (GAM) - EU
description:
**Job Description**
**Company** 
 :
   

  

 Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access, Ethernet transport services and is one of the only US providers who own and operate their own fibre infrastructure spanning the US for diverse Wave connectivity. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 235 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 The Global Account Manager is responsible for identifying and securing new business opportunities globally. By employing consultative selling techniques and relationship-building strategies, you will work directly with the nation’s leading IT Decision Makers to position Cogent's connectivity solutions. This role involves proactive outreach through direct calling, email, and onsite meetings, with a strong focus on understanding clients' current and future connectivity needs. Success in this position will be measured by meeting or exceeding monthly revenue goals and establishing Cogent as a trusted partner across commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Identify, qualify, and secure new business opportunities within a global sales territory, focusing on market segments who require IP transit, Wave connectivity, Ethernet, Colocation and IPv4 services.
* Use direct calling, email outreach, and customer meetings to connect with Key Decision Makers and generate new business opportunities.
* Employ consultative and relationship-driven sales approaches to identify prospective clients’ current and future connectivity needs.
* Position Cogent’s services as the preferred choice by leveraging our extensive global network footprint, which spans commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure customer needs are met and expectations exceeded.
* Maintain and update detailed records of sales activities in CRM systems, tracking progress, and managing customer relationships.


**Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* Telesales experience in any industry, with B2B sales experience being an advantage
* Proven ability to identify, qualify, and generate new business opportunities through proactive prospecting and research.
* Strong communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to engage effectively with Key Decision Makers.
* Self-motivated, positive, and proactive, with a passion for adding value to clients and excelling in a competitive, revenue-driven environment.
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, team-oriented and competitive environment with revenue-driven goals and rewards.
* Familiarity with CRM systems and basic proficiency in Microsoft Office are beneficial.
* Telecommunications experience or knowledge of connectivity solutions is advantageous but not essential.
* Cogent operates a global sales model so foreign language skills are an advantage


**Work Environment:**
 This is an in-office position, five days a week, designed to support your success through focused mentorship, training, and personal coaching.
   

  

 To apply for the Global Account Manager position, please submit your resume and cover letter to careers@cogentco.com .
   

  

 Cogent Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: PA to Country General Manager Sweden (f/m/d)
company_industry: Financial Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Job Description**
**Why join us in 2025?**
 Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us in influencing the future of digital payments in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.
   

  

 If you join us in the role of
 **PA to Country General Manager Sweden,** 
 this is what you can expect from us:
   

  

* Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
* Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
* Home equipment allowance
* Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
* Private health insurance
* Healthcare cost reimbursements
* Voluntary pension fund (company-sponsored retirement plan or pension)
* Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company


**Key Responsibilities:**
* Prepare for meetings by gathering documents, taking notes, and following up on action items.
* Gather and organize materials for review sessions.
* Organize and maintain the Country General Manager's calendar, schedule meetings, and arrange travel.
* Track and manage the Country General Managers expenses, ensuring accurate documentation and timely reimbursement.
* Produce reports, presentations and briefs
* Collaborate with the internal communication team to create, review, and distribute clear internal communications.
* Keep the country intranet updated with news and relevant updates.
* Handle administrative duties like filing documents, entering data, and managing correspondence.
* Create and compile reports, presentations, and other documents.
* Liaise with the facility team to maintain office standards and a healthy work environment.
* Organize and manage office events to foster team engagement and morale.
* Lead an employee driven engagement committee, planning initiatives to enhance employee satisfaction.
* Support special projects by conducting research and preparing detailed reports.
* Work with various departments to ensure deadlines are met and projects are completed smoothly.


**Qualifications, skills and experiences:**
* Excellent written and verbal communication abilities: You will draft, review, and send communications on behalf of the CGM, ensuring clarity and professionalism in all interactions.
* Degree in Business, Economy, Marketing is preferred
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Outstanding organizational and time management skills as well as ability to multitask and prioritize daily workload
* Proactive in identifying challenges and finding solutions
* Anticipate potential challenges and take initiative to address them, ensuring smooth operations and problem resolution.
* Maintaining a high level of confidentiality and professionalism: You will uphold the highest standards of confidentiality and professionalism in all aspects of your work.


**Life at Nexi**
 Discover more about us and what it's like to be part of Nexi by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm\_source=career-platform&utm\_medium=job-openings&utm\_content=standard . Learn about our values, meet our communities, and see how we are shaping the future of digital payments together.
   

  

**Apply now!**
 If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!
   

  

 Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.
   

  

 By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**QUALIFICATIONS**

title: 🚀 We're Hiring: Expert Data Engineer/Full Stack Engineer with Celonis/Pega Backend Experience 🚀
description:
🚀
 **We're Hiring: Expert Data Engineer / Full Stack Engineer** 
 🚀
 



 Do you thrive on solving complex data challenges and crafting scalable solutions? Are you an expert in data engineering with a passion for building state-of-the-art systems? Multiply is on the lookout for a passionate and driven Data Engineer or Full Stack Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us shape the future!
 



**About Us** 
 At Multiply, we believe in unlocking potential through innovative technology and data-driven solutions. We are at the forefront of digital transformation, helping businesses multiply their success by turning data into actionable insights. Join our forward-thinking team and work on projects that truly make a difference.
 



**The Role** 
 As an
 **Expert Data Engineer / Full Stack Engineer** 
 , you will:
 


* **Design & Develop** 
 : Build robust, scalable, and efficient data pipelines and backend systems using state-of-the-art technologies.
* **Integrate Systems** 
 : Seamlessly integrate data solutions into enterprise ecosystems, ensuring smooth workflows and data consistency.
* **Collaborate & Innovate** 
 : Work closely with cross-functional teams to design, test, and deploy end-to-end solutions that drive measurable outcomes.
* **Optimize Processes** 
 : Analyze and optimize existing workflows for performance, scalability, and reliability.
* **Model & Organize Data** 
 : Develop and maintain comprehensive data models to support robust and scalable applications.
* **Ensure Data Quality** 
 : Implement checks and frameworks to maintain high data quality and system reliability.



**What We're Looking For** 



* **Technical Expertise** 
 : Strong proficiency in data engineering and backend technologies, with significant experience in building scalable data systems.
* **Experience in development** 
 of Celonis Platform, Pega Platform and/or Appian Platform
* **Full Stack Skills** 
 : Familiarity with modern web development frameworks and tools (Node.js, React, Angular, etc.) is a plus.
* **Problem Solver** 
 : Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to tackle challenging problems with innovative solutions.
* **Team Player** 
 : Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* **Passion for Data** 
 : A genuine enthusiasm for harnessing the power of data to drive business value.



**Technical Skills & Tools** 



* **Programming Languages** 
 : Python, SQL
* **Data Integration & Transformation** 
 : DBT, RDF, Knowledge Graphs, Apache Jena
* **Data Streaming** 
 : Apache Kafka, Apache Flink
* **Custom Connectors** 
 : Airbyte, Apache Nifi
* **Cloud Technologies** 
 : AWS (S3, Lambda, EC2, Glue, etc.)
* **Orchestration Tools** 
 : Apache Airflow
* **Data Storage & Formats** 
 : PostgreSQL, Apache Iceberg, Apache Hudi, Parquet, Avro
* **Distributed Data Processing** 
 : Apache Spark (PySpark), Flink, Dask
* **Version Control & CI/CD** 
 : Git, GitLab CI/CD, Jenkins, GitHub Actions
* **Containerization & DevOps** 
 : Docker, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform
* **Data Governance & Lineage** 
 : DataHub, OpenLineage
* **Data Privacy & Security** 
 : Open Policy Agent (OPA), Apache Ranger
* **Data Query Engines** 
 : Trino (formerly Presto), Apache Hive, DuckDB
* **Data Quality & Validation** 
 : Great Expectations



**Qualifications** 



* Proven experience in data engineering or full stack development.
* Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or similar.
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is highly desirable.
* Strong knowledge of SQL and database optimization techniques.



**What We Offer** 



* Competitive salary and benefits.
* A vibrant and collaborative work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Flexible working options (remote/hybrid).
* The chance to work on impactful projects with industry leaders.
* **Ready to Multiply Your Career?** 
 Join our team and be part of a company that values innovation, creativity, and results.

title: Senior Software Application Engineer
description:
**Job Description:** Perform functional development, including requirement breakdown, software design, documentation, implementation, testing, and verification.

**Position Overview:**  
Specialize in a technical domain (e.g., Vehicle, HMI, Combustion, Engine After-treatment, Electro-mobility, Powertrain Control, Control Theory, Mechatronics, Diagnostics) to develop innovative features. You will lead system engineering within a technical team and play an active role in project delivery. This includes integrating contributions from team members and ensuring quality and readiness before release.

Your focus will be on the early phases of the development cycle, contributing to technical roadmaps and networking across the organization. Additionally, you’ll support business development and help foster a culture of lifelong learning within the team by coaching and training junior team members.

**Main Responsibilities:**

* Perform functional development for embedded software applications, including requirement breakdown and verification.
* Lead system engineering efforts in a technical team.
* Ensure quality and readiness of deliveries before release.
* Develop technical roadmaps and influence work across different teams.
* Support and mentor junior team members as a trainer or coach.
* Act as a role model for continuous learning and broaden technical expertise into a T-shaped profile.
* Build networks within the automotive organization to enhance collaboration and innovation.
* Clearly articulate the value created in projects and deliverables.

**Who You Are:**

* Hold advanced knowledge obtained through education and extensive work experience in relevant fields.
* Demonstrate strong leadership skills with the ability to guide teams and manage projects effectively.
* Possess a deep understanding of control systems, mechatronics, or diagnostics.
* Show expertise in electro-mobility, powertrain systems, or related areas.
* Skilled in fostering collaboration and influencing outcomes within a wider network.
* Fluent in English and experienced in technical documentation.

**Experience Level:**  
Senior: Position typically requires more than 5 years of relevant experience.

**Additional Details:**

* **Job Posting Start Date:** 2025-02-03
* **Location:** Göteborg

2. How many years of relevant experience you have

title: Senior System Design Engineer
description:
**Position Overview:**  
Are you an experienced and curious Electrical & Electronics engineer with a passion for technical solutions? Do you enjoy exploring new domains in product development and sharing your knowledge with colleagues? Have you previously served as a Team Leader/Scrum Master, or are you eager to develop your leadership skills? If so, this opportunity might be the perfect fit for you.

**The Challenge:**  
The automotive industry is undergoing rapid transformation with digital and connected solutions redefining how we develop and sell products. This evolution demands innovative thinking and solutions that will shape the future of public transportation. We need creative, driven individuals to guide this journey with collaboration, enthusiasm, and passion.

**About the Team:**  
Our team comprises 12 engineers with diverse professional backgrounds united by a shared goal: to develop exceptional products and grow together. Situated near the seaside in Arendal, we enjoy lunch walks along the shore as a refreshing break from our fast-paced work environment.

We specialize in developing Driver Environment and Driver Assistance systems, holding global responsibility for solutions implemented in vehicles worldwide. Our work impacts millions of people daily, ensuring quality and competitiveness in a dynamic industry.

We collaborate with teams in Poland, Mexico, and Brazil, along with affiliated brands in North America, fostering knowledge transfer and competence development to become an even stronger and more passionate team.

**What We Offer:**  
You will play a key role in designing world-class driver experience solutions, focusing on ergonomics, usability, and visibility. Working in an agile/lean environment, you’ll join a high-performing cross-functional team that collaborates with various stakeholders to achieve Driver Environment and Driver Assistance goals.

**Main Responsibilities:**

* Ensure that ECU software and hardware meet technical, quality, time, and cost requirements.
* Coordinate, document, and release new ECU and ESW in line with internal processes, ensuring strategy compliance and requirement fulfillment.
* Plan, implement, and monitor the development of ECU and ESW in both the short and long term.
* Develop and maintain roadmaps.
* Serve as the main point of contact for various stakeholders.
* Act as the Team Leader, facilitating agile ceremonies and PI planning.
* Support team activities and development.

**Who You Are:**

* A skilled team player with excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Genuinely interested in product development.
* Hold a BSc or MSc degree in electrical/software engineering (or equivalent).
* Experienced in system and architectural design for Instrument Clusters. Familiarity with internal tools and processes is a plus.
* Possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Positive, structured, and eager to learn new skills.

**Experience Level:**  
Senior: Position typically requires more than 5 years of relevant experience.

**Additional Details:**

* **Start Date:** 2025-02-24
* **Location:** Göteborg

1. CV  
2. How many years of relevant experience you have

title: System Verification Engineer
description:
Looking for a System Verification Engineer with interest in Verification, Fault tracing and Bug fixing within the area of automotive software development. You will work with test and verification of our inhouse nodes in a subsystem connecting the Instrument Cluster (IC3, IC-GFX) and Body Builder Interface nodes (BBM, BIO, BIM).

**Main area of responsibility**

* Subsystem testing in rig (HIL) both manually and automated
* Fault tracing
* Develop, write, perform and report test cases based on the requirements on system
* Bug fixes
* Securing quality and readiness before release

**This is you:**

* BSc or MSc degree in electrical/software engineering or equivalent is highly valuable
* Programming experience (preferable Pyhton or CAPL)
* T-shaping mindset, experience or interest in learning new areas
* Self-motivated, you will belong to an experienced team but must be able to take own initiatives

**Nice to have**

* Experience of verification in HIL system rigs
* Experience from CANalyzer and CANoeProlongation is possible

**Experience: position typically requires 2 to 5 years relevant experience**

description:

**About the Role:** 




  




* Develop and maintain data products that bridge the gap between data producers and consumers.
* Work closely with stakeholders to ensure the right functionality for improved business performance.
* Be part of an agile, dynamic team that continuously learns and improves.



  





**Key Requirements:** 




  




* 5 - 8 years of experience in data engineering.
* Expertise in
 **Azure** 
 ,
 **Apache Spark** 
 ,
 **Python** 
 ,
 **Databricks** 
 , and
 **Snowflake** 
 .
* Strong experience in
 **data pipelines** 
 ,

 , and
 **agile methodologies** 
 .



  





**Why You’ll Love This Role:** 




  




* Opportunity to work with innovative technologies in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

**Ready to Drive the Future of Data?** 




 Apply now and be part of a team that’s transforming the automotive landscape through digital innovation.
